column11: The gift of time has afforded me the opportunity to ground, slow down, reevaluate what's important in my life. With the quietude, yoga, gratitude,self study, and mediataion, Im able to see and feel more clearly as I was going in so many different directions prior to the required isolation brought on by the pandemic. I was burning out.The time to myself has afforded me the opportunity to read, paint, write, reflect and still connect with others. I'm sad about people suffering. That noted, suffering is part of the human condition.  My illusion of control is where I fall into the fear trap & anxiety rears it's head. But when I sit in stillness I realize that the Universe/Divine/God is in charge and surrounding circumstance are out of my control, even if i don'tfully understand. My faith in this or something better sustains me.I can only control what I can control and if I get sick and die, then, as much as I'm not ready to leave, there is little I can do as it's my expiration date. At the end of the day, appreciation for what is good and savoring those moments keeps me peaceful, fulfilled and inspired. Lastly, seeing so many people come together gives me great joy and hope for humanity.
column12: The gift of time. It's not just one factor but a conglommeration - the mix of communication with family, reading ,exercising, time for creating, and so forth

My husband who was lots of fun and comfortable to be with passed away in June and I miss him now so very much. But I also feel great anger at Trump for his lying, bragging and blaming of others.
Cannot go about normal life.
loneliness
Lonliness
Knowing the most vulnerable populations and countries will suffer greatly

Because I can't feel friends and feel less of a sense of purpose. Also because I'm single and feel a longing for intimate connection with a partner which I will be unable to find until after this is all over.
Mostly seeing other people's negative emotions such as stress, anxiety, sadness, regret, nostalgia, etc. That makes me sad too.
The hardship and tragedy that so many people have to experience because we don't have good systems in place for handling an emergency like this.
People dying, being far away from friends and family
The fact that many people die every day
To many questions in my mind for example : Is that for real?
The situation of Italy
I lost time with my friends, internship, and pursuing my hobbies before I have to move back home.
That a can’t help people
Because people are dying including my friend’s brother who died of Covid19
Loss of life and stress on front line public servants and health care workers
So many peoples are ill
the human toll the pandemic is taking both in terms of lives and livelihoods
I feel sad the most because it is heartbreaking to see the impact of COVID on families and business, which is in essence people.
Uncertainty, when can I travel again to see people that I love? When can I do things again that I love, probably not this year anymore.
Trauma from my childhood that has re-emerged in this stressful situation.
Isolation from family and friends
See others suffer
My orthodox Easter has to be celebrated over live stream, My freshman year which I loved ended, and I couldn't experience my 1st year of track for the school.
column12: God and having faith in him, and during this time many people are coming together

column11: I am sad for my kids who are missing out on so many things!!!
Not able to see daughter and grandchildren.
Situation generally
Family games
Nothing in particular
I want coronavirus to disappear
Nazdravaniile copilului meu
Less time to spend with people I care about
Nature
That all my plans were cancelled by this pandemic
Time spent with my family
Loved person
Staying in house 24/24
Can't see someone important to me
Family
Lack of social connections
Lack of liberty and missing those dear to me
That I can't see people dear to me
the whole period with the pandemic in which I can't see many of my loved ones, the cancellation of all festive events and some family health problems (not related to the virus).
To listen to music
I can't think of an answer
Uncertainty, lack of clarity
We have a risk that we need control it

Everything except how I behave is out of my control, but I can choose to feel grateful for what I do have, good health, available food, comfortable surroundings.  I can allow this very serious health concern be transformative.  I feel the pressures put on populations have given the physical world a break, kind of like a bit of natural medicine.
column12: Technology that has allowed me to not worry about my family and loved ones

column11: Not knowing how tomorrow will be
column12: Work.      Thank you! Lots of hugs from Portugal!

column11: Not knowing when it will end
column12: Taking time to do things I never had time before: Trying hobbies for the first time

column11: It is still to early to understand the degree in which this will impact the world.

Worry is an e-motion (energy in motion) which inhabits me and rears it’s head often in my life.  It is very active at this time.  During my meditations I beginning to see how worry is connected to other e-motions.
Concerned for all who are sick and for the effects on the world long term
Not being able to be with friends and family
